name: snap_cancelBackgroundEvent
description:
Cancel a background event created by
[`snap_scheduleBackgroundEvent`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_schedulebackgroundevent).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_cancelBackgroundEvent` method.

properties.description: The ID of the background event to cancel.
properties.name: id

result.description:
The result returned for the `snap_cancelBackgroundEvent` method.

This method does not return anything.

name: snap_clearState
description: Clear the entire state of the Snap.

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_clearState` method.

properties.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state. Encrypted state can only
be used if the extension is unlocked, while unencrypted state can be used
whether the extension is locked or unlocked.
properties.name: encrypted

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_clearState` method.

name: snap_closeWebSocket
description:
Closes a WebSocket connection that was previously opened with
[`snap_openWebSocket`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_openwebsocket).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_closeWebSocket` method.

properties.description: The ID of the WebSocket connection to close.
properties.name: id

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_closeWebSocket` method.

name: snap_createInterface
description:
Create an interactive interface for use in
[interactive UI](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/interactive-ui/).

parameters.type: { ui: JSXElement; context?: Record<string, Json> | null }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_createInterface` method.

properties.description:
The [custom UI](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/) to
create.
properties.name: ui

properties.description:
Optional context for the interface, which can be used to provide additional
information about the interface to the Snap, without being part of the UI
itself.
properties.name: context

result.description:
The interface's ID to be used in subsequent calls to custom UI methods such
as [`snap_updateInterface`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_updateinterface),
or to display the interface using one of the interface display methods such
as [`snap_dialog`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_dialog).

name: snap_dialog
description:
Display a [dialog](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/dialogs/)
in the MetaMask UI.

parameters.type: { content: JSXElement } | { id: string } | { type: "alert"; content: JSXElement } | { type: "alert"; id: string } | { type: "confirmation"; content: JSXElement } | { type: "confirmation"; id: string } | { type: "prompt"; content: JSXElement; placeholder?: string | null } | { type: "prompt"; id: string; placeholder?: string | null }
parameters.description:
An object containing the contents of the dialog.

- `type` - The type of dialog. Not providing a type will create a fully
[custom dialog](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/dialogs/#display-a-custom-dialog).
Possible values are:
  - `alert` - An alert that can only be acknowledged.
  - `confirmation` - A confirmation that can be accepted or rejected.
  - `prompt` - A prompt where the user can enter a text response.

- One of:
  - `content` - The content of the alert, as a
[custom UI](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/) component.
  - `id` - The ID of an
[interactive interface](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_createinterface).
- `placeholder` - An optional placeholder text to display in the dialog. Only
applicable for the `prompt` dialog.

options.type: { type: "alert"; content: JSXElement } | { type: "alert"; id: string }
{ type: "confirmation"; content: JSXElement } | { type: "confirmation"; id: string }
{ type: "prompt"; content: JSXElement; placeholder?: string | null } | { type: "prompt"; id: string; placeholder?: string | null }
{ type: "prompt"; content: JSXElement; placeholder?: string | null }
{ type: "prompt"; id: string; placeholder?: string | null }

result.description:
- If the dialog is an `alert`, the result is `null`.
- If the dialog is a `confirmation`, the result is a boolean indicating
whether the user confirmed the dialog.
- If the dialog is a `prompt`, the result is the value entered by
the user.

name: snap_getBackgroundEvents
description: Get the scheduled background events for the Snap.

parameters.description:
The request parameters for the `snap_getBackgroundEvents` method.

This method does not accept any parameters.

result.type: { id: string; scheduledAt: string; snapId: SnapId; date: string; request: { method: string; jsonrpc?: "2.0" | null; id?: number | string | null; params?: JsonRpcParams } }[]
result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_getBackgroundEvents` method.

It consists of an array background events (if any) for a snap.

element.type: { id: string; scheduledAt: string; snapId: SnapId; date: string; request: { method: string; jsonrpc?: "2.0" | null; id?: number | string | null; params?: JsonRpcParams } }
element.description:
Background event type.

Note: The date generated when scheduling an event with a duration will be
represented in UTC.

properties.description: The unique id representing the event.
properties.name: id

properties.description:
The ISO 8601 time stamp of when the event was
scheduled.
properties.name: scheduledAt

properties.description: The id of the snap that scheduled the event.
properties.name: snapId

properties.description: The ISO 8601 date of when the event is scheduled for.
properties.name: date

properties.type: { method: string; jsonrpc?: "2.0" | null; id?: number | string | null; params?: JsonRpcParams }
properties.description:
The request that is supplied to the `onCronjob` handler
when the event is fired.
properties.name: request

name: snap_getBip32Entropy
description:
Enables you to [manage users' non-EVM accounts](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/non-evm-networks/)
by deriving the [SLIP-10](https://github.com/satoshilabs/slips/blob/master/slip-0010.md)
keys specified by the `path` and `curve` parameters. The keys are derived
using the entropy from the user's Secret Recovery Phrase.

If the keys you want to derive conform to the [BIP-44](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0044.mediawiki)
structure, use [snap_getBip44Entropy](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_getbip44entropy)
instead. Otherwise, use this method.

This method is designed to be used with the [`@metamask/key-tree`](https://npmjs.com/package/@metamask/key-tree)
module. `@metamask/key-tree` can help you get the [extended private keys](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0032.mediawiki#extended-keys)
for user addresses, but it's your responsibility to know how to use those
keys to, for example, derive an address for the relevant protocol or sign a
transaction for the user.

parameters.type: { curve: "ed25519" | "ed25519Bip32" | "secp256k1"; path: string[] } & { source?: string | null }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getBip32Entropy` method.

properties.description:
The curve to use for the derived key. This must be a curve supported by
[`@metamask/key-tree`](https://npmjs.com/package/@metamask/key-tree).
properties.name: curve

properties.description:
The derivation path to use for the derived key, represented as an array of
path segments. For example, the path `m/44'/1'/0'/0/0` would be represented
as `['m', "44'", "1'", "0'", '0', '0']`.
properties.name: path

properties.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.
properties.name: source

result.type: { depth: number; masterFingerprint?: number | null; parentFingerprint: number; index: number; network?: "mainnet" | "testnet" | null; privateKey?: string | null; publicKey: string; chainCode: string; curve: "ed25519" | "ed25519Bip32" | "secp256k1" }
result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getBip32Entropy` method.

properties.description: The 0-indexed path depth of this node.
properties.name: depth

properties.description:
The fingerprint of the master node, i.e., the node at depth 0. May be
undefined if this node was created from an extended key.
properties.name: masterFingerprint

properties.description: The fingerprint of the parent key, or 0 if this is a master node.
properties.name: parentFingerprint

properties.description: The index of the node, or 0 if this is a master node.
properties.name: index

properties.description:
The network for the node. This is only used for extended keys, and defaults
to `mainnet`.
properties.name: network

properties.description: The (optional) private key of this node.
properties.name: privateKey

properties.description: The public key of this node.
properties.name: publicKey

properties.description: The chain code of this node.
properties.name: chainCode

properties.description: The name of the curve used by the node.
properties.name: curve

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_getBip32PublicKey
description:
Gets the [BIP-32](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0032.mediawiki)
public key for the derivation path specified by the `path` parameter. Note
that this returns the public key, not the extended public key (`xpub`), or
Ethereum address.

parameters.type: { curve: "ed25519" | "ed25519Bip32" | "secp256k1"; path: string[] } & { compressed?: boolean | null; source?: string | null }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getBip32PublicKey` method.

properties.description:
The curve to use for the derived key. This must be a curve supported by
[`@metamask/key-tree`](https://npmjs.com/package/@metamask/key-tree).
properties.name: curve

properties.description:
The derivation path to use for the derived key, represented as an array of
path segments. For example, the path `m/44'/1'/0'/0/0` would be represented
as `['m', "44'", "1'", "0'", '0', '0']`.
properties.name: path

properties.description: Whether to return the compressed public key. Defaults to `false`.
properties.name: compressed

properties.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.
properties.name: source

result.description:
The public key as hexadecimal string. May be compressed or uncompressed
depending on the `compressed` parameter provided in the request parameters.

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_getBip44Entropy
description:
Enables you to [manage users' non-EVM accounts](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/non-evm-networks/)
by deriving the [BIP-44](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0044.mediawiki)
keys specified by the `coinType` parameter. The keys are derived using the
entropy from the user's Secret Recovery Phrase.

If the keys you want to derive don't conform to the BIP-44 structure, use
[`snap_getBip32Entropy`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_getbip32entropy)
instead.

This method is designed to be used with the [`@metamask/key-tree`](https://npmjs.com/package/@metamask/key-tree)
module. `@metamask/key-tree` can help you get the [extended private keys](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0032.mediawiki#extended-keys)
for user addresses, but it's your responsibility to know how to use those
keys to, for example, derive an address for the relevant protocol or sign a
transaction for the user.

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getBip44Entropy` method.

properties.description:
The coin type to use for the derived key, as specified in the
[SLIP-44 registry](https://github.com/satoshilabs/slips/blob/master/slip-0044.md).
properties.name: coinType

properties.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.
properties.name: source

result.type: { depth: 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5; masterFingerprint?: number | null; parentFingerprint: number; index: number; network?: "mainnet" | "testnet" | null; privateKey?: string | null; publicKey: string; chainCode: string } & { coin_type: number; path: `m / bip32:${number}' / bip32:${number}'` }
result.description: The result returned by the `snap_getBip44Entropy` method.

properties.description:
The 0-indexed BIP-44 path depth of this node.

A BIP-44 path is of the form:

`m / 44' / coin_type' / account' / change / address_index`

With the following depths:

`0 / 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 / 5`
properties.name: depth

properties.description:
The fingerprint of the master node, i.e., the node at depth 0. May be
undefined if this node was created from an extended key.
properties.name: masterFingerprint

properties.description: The fingerprint of the parent key, or 0 if this is a master node.
properties.name: parentFingerprint

properties.description: The index of the node, or 0 if this is a master node.
properties.name: index

properties.description:
The network for the node. This is only used for extended keys, and defaults
to `mainnet`.
properties.name: network

properties.description:
The hexadecimal string representation of the private key for this node.
May be `undefined` if the node is a public node.
properties.name: privateKey

properties.description: The hexadecimal string representation of the public key for this node.
properties.name: publicKey

properties.description: The hexadecimal string representation of the chain code for this node.
properties.name: chainCode

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_getClientStatus
description: Get the status of the client running the Snap.

result.type: { clientVersion: string; platformVersion: string; locked: boolean; active: boolean }
result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_getClientStatus` method.

It returns an object containing useful information about the client.

properties.description: The semantic version of the client that the Snap is running in.
properties.name: clientVersion

properties.description: The Snaps Platform version that the client is running.
properties.name: platformVersion

properties.description: A boolean flag that indicates whether the client is locked or not.
properties.name: locked

properties.description: A boolean flag that indicates whether the client is active or not.
properties.name: active

name: snap_getEntropy
description:
Get a deterministic 256-bit entropy value, specific to the Snap and the
user's account. You can use this entropy to generate a private key, or any
other value that requires a high level of randomness. Other Snaps can't
access this entropy, and it changes if the user's secret recovery phrase
changes.

You can optionally specify a salt to generate different entropy for different
purposes. Using a salt results in entropy unrelated to the entropy generated
without a salt.

This value is deterministic: it's always the same for the same Snap, user
account, and salt.

parameters.type: { version: 1; salt?: string | null; source?: string | null }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getEntropy` method.

properties.description:
The version of the entropy to retrieve. This is reserved for future use,
and as of now, only version 1 is supported.
properties.name: version

properties.description:
An arbitrary string to be used as a salt for the entropy. This can be used
to generate different entropy for different purposes.
properties.name: salt

properties.description:
The ID of the entropy source to use. If not specified, the primary entropy
source will be used. For a list of available entropy sources, see the
`snap_listEntropySources` method.
properties.name: source

result.description: The entropy as a hexadecimal string.

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_getFile
description:
Gets a static file's content in UTF-8, Base64, or hexadecimal.

The file must be specified in [the Snap's manifest file](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/static-files/).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getFile` method.

properties.description:
The path to the file, relative to the Snap's package directory
(that is, one level above `src`).
properties.name: path

properties.description: The encoding to use when retrieving the file. Defaults to `base64`.
properties.name: encoding

result.description: The file content as a string in the requested encoding.

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_getInterfaceContext
description:
Get the context of an [interface](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/interactive-ui/)
created by [`snap_createInterface`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_createinterface).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getInterfaceContext` method.

properties.description: The interface ID.
properties.name: id

result.description: The context for the given interface.

name: snap_getInterfaceState
description:
Get the form state of an [interface](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/interactive-ui/)
created by [`snap_createInterface`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_createinterface).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getInterfaceState` method.

properties.description: The interface ID.
properties.name: id

result.type: Record<string, { addresses: `${string}:${string}:${string}`[]; accountId: string } | { name: string; size: number; contentType: string; contents: string } | { symbol: string; name: string; asset: `${string}:${string}/${string}:${string}` } | boolean | Record<string, { addresses: `${string}:${string}:${string}`[]; accountId: string } | { name: string; size: number; contentType: string; contents: string } | { symbol: string; name: string; asset: `${string}:${string}/${string}:${string}` } | boolean | string | null> | string | null>
result.description:
The state of the given interface. This is a `Record` of the form state, where
the keys are the `name` properties of the form fields, and the values are the
current values of those fields, depending on the type of the field.

For example, for a text field, the value would be a `string`, for a checkbox
field, the value would be a `boolean`, and for a file upload field, the value
would be a `File` object. The exact structure of the state depends on the
form fields that were defined when the interface was created.

name: snap_getLocale
description:
Get the user's locale setting. You can use this method to localize text in
your Snap.

Note that this method is deprecated. We recommend using
[`snap_getPreferences`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_getpreferences)
instead, which provides access to the user's locale as well as other
preferences.

result.description: The user's locale setting as a [language code](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/blob/develop/app/_locales/index.json).

name: snap_getPreferences
description: Gets the user's preferences.

result.type: { locale: string; currency: string; hideBalances: boolean; useSecurityAlerts: boolean; simulateOnChainActions: boolean; useTokenDetection: boolean; batchCheckBalances: boolean; displayNftMedia: boolean; useNftDetection: boolean; useExternalPricingData: boolean; showTestnets: boolean }
result.description: An object containing the user's preferences.

properties.description: The user's locale setting as a language code.
properties.name: locale

properties.description: The user's preferred fiat currency code.
properties.name: currency

properties.description: Whether the user has chosen to hide balances.
properties.name: hideBalances

properties.description:
Whether to run transactions and signatures
through security providers.
properties.name: useSecurityAlerts

properties.description:
Whether to simulate transactions and
signatures.
properties.name: simulateOnChainActions

properties.description: Whether to auto-detect tokens.
properties.name: useTokenDetection

properties.description:
Whether to fetch balances in an aggregated
manner.
properties.name: batchCheckBalances

properties.description: Whether to display NFT media.
properties.name: displayNftMedia

properties.description: Whether to auto-detect NFTs.
properties.name: useNftDetection

properties.description:
Whether to get token price data from an
external source.
properties.name: useExternalPricingData

properties.description: Whether to show testnets.
properties.name: showTestnets

name: snap_getState
description:
Get the state of the Snap, or a specific value within the state. By default,
the data is automatically encrypted using a Snap-specific key and
automatically decrypted when retrieved. You can set `encrypted` to `false` to
use unencrypted storage (available when the client is locked).

parameters.type: { key?: string | null; encrypted?: boolean | null }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_getState` method.

properties.description:
The key of the state to retrieve. If not provided, the entire
state is retrieved. This may contain Lodash-style path syntax, e.g.,
`a.b.c`, with the exception of array syntax.
properties.name: key

properties.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state. Encrypted state can only
be used if the client is unlocked, while unencrypted state can be used
whether the client is locked or unlocked.
properties.name: encrypted

result.description:
The state of the Snap. If a key was provided in the request parameters, this
is the value of that key in the state. Otherwise, this is the entire state.

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_getWebSockets
description: Get the connected WebSockets for the Snap.

parameters.description:
The request parameters for the `snap_getWebSockets` method.

This method does not accept any parameters.

result.type: { id: string; url: string; protocols: string[] }[]
result.description:
An array of connected WebSockets for the Snap. Each WebSocket is represented
by an object containing the following properties:

- `id` - The unique identifier of the WebSocket connection.
- `url` - The URL of the WebSocket connection.
- `protocols` - An array of subprotocols used in the WebSocket connection (if
any).

element.type: { id: string; url: string; protocols: string[] }

name: snap_listEntropySources
description:
Get a list of entropy sources available to the Snap. The requesting origin
must have at least one of the following permissions to access entropy source
metadata:

- `snap_getBip32Entropy`
- `snap_getBip32PublicKey`
- `snap_getBip44Entropy`
- `snap_getEntropy`

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_listEntropySources` method.

result.type: { name: string; id: string; type: "mnemonic"; primary: boolean }[]
result.description:
An array of entropy sources available to the Snap. Each entropy source
consists of:

- `name` - The name of the entropy source.
- `id` - The ID of the entropy source.
- `type` - The type of the entropy source. Currently, only `mnemonic` is
supported.
- `primary` - Whether the entropy source is the primary source.

element.type: { name: string; id: string; type: "mnemonic"; primary: boolean }
element.description:
An entropy source that can be used to retrieve entropy using the
`snap_get*Entropy` methods.

properties.description: The name of the entropy source.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The ID of the entropy source
properties.name: id

properties.description: The type of the entropy source. Currently, only `mnemonic` is supported.
properties.name: type

properties.description: Whether the entropy source is the primary source.
properties.name: primary

name: snap_manageAccounts
description:
Manage account management Snap accounts. This method is organized into
multiple sub-methods which each take their own parameters:

- `createAccount`
- `updateAccount`
- `deleteAccount`
- `listAccounts`
- `submitResponse`

parameters.type: { method: string } | { method: string; params: JsonRpcParams }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_manageAccounts` method.

result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_manageAccounts` method, which is the result
returned by the Snap.

name: snap_manageState
description:
Allow the Snap to persist up to 64 MB of data to disk and retrieve it at
will. By default, the data is automatically encrypted using a Snap-specific
key and automatically decrypted when retrieved. You can set `encrypted` to
`false` to use unencrypted storage (available when the client is locked).

parameters.type: { operation: "clear"; encrypted?: boolean | null } | { operation: "get"; encrypted?: boolean | null } | { operation: "update"; encrypted?: boolean | null; newState: Record<string, Json> }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_manageState` method.

commonProperties.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state. Encrypted state can only
be used if the extension is unlocked, while unencrypted state can be used
whether the extension is locked or unlocked.
commonProperties.name: encrypted

options.description: The clear state operation, which clears the state.

properties.description: The operation to perform on the state. Must be `clear`.
properties.name: operation

options.description: The get state operation, which retrieves the state.

properties.description: The operation to perform on the state. Must be `get`.
properties.name: operation

options.type: { operation: "update"; encrypted?: boolean | null; newState: Record<string, Json> }
options.description: The update state operation, which updates the state.

properties.description:
The operation to perform on the state. Must be
`update`.
properties.name: operation

properties.description: The new state to set.
properties.name: newState

result.description:
If the operation is `get`, the result is the state. Otherwise, the result is
`null`.

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_notify
description:
Display a
[notification](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/notifications/) in
MetaMask or natively in the OS. Snaps can trigger a short (up to 80
characters) notification message for actionable or time sensitive
information. `inApp` notifications can also include an optional
[expanded view](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/notifications/#expanded-view).
The expanded view has a title, content, and optional footer link shown when
a user clicks on the notification.

parameters.type: { type: "inApp"; message: string } | { type: "inApp"; message: string; content: JSXElement; title: string; footerLink?: { href: string; text: string } | null } | { type: "native"; message: string }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_notify` method.

options.type: { type: "inApp"; message: string; content: JSXElement; title: string; footerLink?: { href: string; text: string } | null }

result.description:
The result returned by the `snap_notify` method.

This method does not return anything.

name: snap_openWebSocket
description:
Open a WebSocket connection to the specified URL with optional protocols.

Note: This method is only available to snaps that have the
[`endowment:network-access`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/network-access/)
permission.

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_openWebSocket` method.

properties.description: The `wss://` URL of the WebSocket connection to open.
properties.name: url

properties.description:
The optional protocols to use for the WebSocket
connection.
properties.name: protocols

result.description:
The ID of the opened WebSocket connection, which can be used to reference the
connection in subsequent calls to [`snap_sendWebSocketMessage`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_sendwebsocketmessage)
and [`snap_closeWebSocket`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_closewebsocket).

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_resolveInterface
description:
Resolve an interactive interface. For use in
[custom dialogs](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/dialogs/#display-a-custom-dialog).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_resolveInterface` method.

properties.description: The interface ID.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The value to resolve the interface with.
properties.name: value

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_resolveInterface` method.

name: snap_scheduleBackgroundEvent
description:
Schedule a background event for a Snap. The background event will trigger a
JSON-RPC request to the Snap at the scheduled time, handled by the
`onCronjob` entry point in the Snap.

The schedule can be defined using either an ISO 8601 date or duration string.
For example:

- Using a date: `2026-12-31T23:59:59Z`
- Using a duration: `P1DT2H` (which represents a duration of 1 day and 2
hours)

parameters.type: { date: string; request: { method: string; params?: JsonRpcParams } } | { duration: string; request: { method: string; params?: JsonRpcParams } }
parameters.description:
The request parameters for the `snap_scheduleBackgroundEvent` method.

Note: The date generated from a duration will be represented in UTC.

options.type: { date: string; request: { method: string; params?: JsonRpcParams } }
{ duration: string; request: { method: string; params?: JsonRpcParams } }

result.description: The ID of the scheduled background event.

name: snap_sendWebSocketMessage
description:
Send a message to an open WebSocket connection. The message will be sent to
the WebSocket connection with the specified ID, which must have been
previously opened by the snap using the [`snap_openWebSocket`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/snap_openwebsocket/)
method.

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_sendWebSocketMessage` method.

properties.description: The ID of the WebSocket connection to send a message to.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The message to send.
properties.name: message

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_sendWebSocketMessage` method.

name: snap_setState
description:
Allow the Snap to persist up to 64 MB of data to disk and retrieve it at
will. By default, the data is automatically encrypted using a Snap-specific
key and automatically decrypted when retrieved. You can set `encrypted` to
`false` to use unencrypted storage (available when the client is locked).

If the key is `undefined`, the value is expected to be an object. In this
case, the value is set as the new root state.

If the key is not `undefined`, the value is set in the state at the key. If
the key does not exist, it is created (and any missing intermediate keys are
created as well).

parameters.type: { key?: string | null; value: Json; encrypted?: boolean | null }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_setState` method.

properties.description:
The key of the state to update. If not provided, the entire
state is updated. This may contain Lodash-style path syntax, e.g.,
`a.b.c`, with the exception of array syntax.
properties.name: key

properties.description: The value to set the state to.
properties.name: value

properties.description:
Whether to use the separate encrypted state, or the
unencrypted state. Defaults to the encrypted state. Encrypted state can only
be used if the client is unlocked, while unencrypted state can be used
whether the client is locked or unlocked.
properties.name: encrypted

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_setState` method.

examples.name: Manifest
Usage

name: snap_updateInterface
description:
Update an interactive interface. For use in
[interactive UI](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/features/custom-ui/interactive-ui/).

parameters.type: { id: string; ui: JSXElement; context?: Record<string, Json> | null }
parameters.description: The request parameters for the `snap_createInterface` method.

properties.description: The interface id.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The components to display in the interface.
properties.name: ui

result.description: The result returned by the `snap_updateInterface` method.

name: wallet_getSnaps
description: Get permitted and installed Snaps for the requesting origin.

result.description: A map of Snap IDs to either the Snap metadata or an error.

name: wallet_invokeKeyring
description:
Invoke a keyring method of a Snap. This calls the `onKeyringRequest` handler
of the Snap.

The Snap must be installed and the dapp must have permission to communicate
with the Snap, or the request is rejected. The dapp can install the Snap and
request permission to communicate with it using [`wallet_requestSnaps`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/wallet_requestsnaps).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `wallet_invokeKeyring` method.

properties.description: The ID of the Snap to invoke.
properties.name: snapId

properties.description: The JSON-RPC request to send to the Snap.
properties.name: request

result.description: The result returned by the Snap.

name: wallet_invokeSnap
description:
Invoke a method of a Snap, designated by the `snapId` parameter, with a
JSON-RPC request specified in the `request` parameter. This is effectively a
wrapper around [`wallet_snap`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/wallet_snap)
that allows for more convenient invocation of Snap methods without needing to
specify the full `wallet_snap` parameters.

The Snap must be installed and the dapp must have permission to communicate
with the Snap, or the request is rejected. The dapp can install the Snap and
request permission to communicate with it using [`wallet_requestSnaps`](https://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/wallet_requestsnaps).

parameters.description: The request parameters for the `wallet_invokeSnap` method.

properties.description: The ID of the Snap to invoke.
properties.name: snapId

properties.description: The JSON-RPC request to send to the Snap.
properties.name: request

result.description: The result of the Snap method call.

name: wallet_requestSnaps
description:
Request permission for a dapp to communicate with the specified Snaps and
attempt to install them if they're not already installed.

If the Snap version range is specified, MetaMask attempts to install a
version of the Snap that satisfies the range. If a compatible version of the
Snap is already installed, the request succeeds. If an incompatible version
is installed, MetaMask attempts to update the Snap to the latest version that
satisfies the range. The request succeeds if the Snap is successfully
installed.

If the installation of any Snap fails, or the user rejects the installation
or permission request, this method returns the error that caused the failure.

parameters.description:
An object mapping the IDs of the requested Snaps to optional SemVer version
ranges. The SemVer version ranges use the same semantics as NPM
`package.json` ranges.

result.description:
An object mapping the IDs of the requested Snaps to either the installed Snap
or an error if the Snap failed to install or was not permitted.

name: wallet_snap
description:
Calls the specified JSON-RPC API method of the specified Snap. The Snap
must be installed and the dapp must have permission to communicate with the
Snap, or the request is rejected. The dapp can install the Snap and request
permission to communicate with it using
[`wallet_requestSnaps`](http://docs.metamask.io/snaps/reference/snaps-api/wallet_requestsnaps).

result.description: The result of the Snap method call.
